0.caption: {\fad(1900,600)\fs65\fnCaxton Roman Book\c&HEFF7F5&\fscx90\fsp2.401\bord0\be0\shad3.001\pos(960,740.593)}In ancient times, the land lay covered in forests,
{\fad(1900,600)\fs65\fnCaxton Roman Book\c&HEFF7F5&\fscx90\fsp2.401\bord0\be0\shad3.001\pos(960,825.927)}where from ages long past dwelt the spirits of the gods.
Good timing. Hii-sama says\Nto get back to the village.

100.caption: Good timing. Hii-sama says\Nto get back to the village.
- He says the mountains are strange...\N- No birds in sight.
All right, I'll go to him. You hurry back home.
I don't know. It's not a person...
In the village, Hii-sama's called everyone in.

200.caption: It's headed toward the village!\NIt's going to attack!
Don't touch it! Its curse will be on you!
O mountain god who cannot be\Nwithout name, why do you rampage so?

300.caption: Stop! Do not destroy our village!
Kaya, don't touch it! It's no ordinary wound!
Pour this water over it... slowly.

400.caption: O raging god unknown to us...
I humbly, respectfully speak to thee.
Where you have fallen we will\Nraise a mound and perform rites.
Bear us no hate, and be at peace.
You shall know my hatred and my suffering.
The boar came from a land far to the west.
A poison within him goaded him on,\Nrotting his flesh...
...drawing evil as he ran, making a demon out of him.

500.caption: Show your right arm.
Hii-sama!
Prince Ashitaka, are you steeled\Nto gaze upon your fate?
Yes. I was resolved when I let my arrow fly.
The scar will seep into your bones\Nand you will die.
Hii-sama, can nothing be done?!
He was defending the village, and the girls!
To simply sit and wait for death...
You cannot change your fate.
However, you can wait, or you can rise to meet it.
Look.
This was deep in the boar's body.
He was in terrible agony. It shattered\Nhis bones, tore at his entrails...
What else could have made him into a demon?
Something sinister\Nhas befallen the land of the west.
If you journey there, and see with eyes unclouded...
...there may be a way to lift the curse.
Understood.
More than 500 years have gone since\Nthe Yamato people drove us into this land.
Now we hear how their king's power fades...
...and the fangs of his shoguns are broken.
But the blood of our tribe likewise grows thin.

600.caption: And now, bitter fate...\NThe youth who was one day to lead us...
The law forbids that we watch as you go. Be well.
I'll accept my punishment.\NPlease, remember me by this.
But it's your precious jeweled dagger!
I put my blessing on it to protect you.
I'll think of you always... always. Be sure of that.

800.caption: This gruel tastes like hot water!
What is this? This isn't money!
If it's coins you want, I'll pay you.

900.caption: Listen, everyone, is there a money changer here?
Huh? No?
I'm just a mere priest, but I'd say\Nthis is worth one... no, three sacks of rice!
Wait, young sir!
Give it back! That's mine!
Hey! Don't be in such a rush!
No need to thank me.\NIt's I who should thank you.
When I got dragged into a skirmish with\Nthose samurai, it was thanks to you I was saved.
You fight like one possessed!
Ah, you see those men, too?\NKeep your gold hidden, my lad.
People's hearts have grown hard\Nthroughout the land.
Getting robbed in our sleep's no fun. Shall we run?
Oh, so the boar god became a demon...
I followed its footprints, but as soon\Nas I got down to the village I lost them.
Is that so...
Look over there.
The last time I came here, there was a fine village.
Maybe there was a flood\Nor a landslide... I'm sure many died.
The land teems\Nwith the clamoring of bitter ghosts...
...dead from war, sick or starved\Nand fallen where they stood.
A curse, you say? This world is a curse.

1000.caption: Ah, this is good!
I shouldn't have gone into\Nthat village. I killed two men.
No, thanks to you I was saved.
Give me your bowl. You should eat.
We all die eventually.
Some sooner, some later.
Hm, an elegant bowl...
You remind me of the ancient tales,\Npassed down through writing...
Brave people, far to the east...
...who used stone arrowheads\Nand rode red elk... the Emishi.
What's most important, though,\Nis to avoid the jaws of death.
Or so my old teacher used to say.
Eat up, my lad. It's your rice!
Have you ever seen anything like this?
What is it?
It was inside the body of the giant boar.\NIt's what inflicted his deadly would.
As you continue west, deep in the mountains,\Nis a dense forest where no man may tread.
The forest of the Deer God.
The forest of the Deer God?
They say the beasts there are giants,\Nand live as in ages past.

1100.caption: It's not far now! Stay on your guard!
Calm the oxen! Don't rush!\NForm your ranks!
Slow down and keep your powder dry!

1200.caption: Damn monsters, all bark and no bite.
Those were just the pups. Where's the mother?
She's immortal. She won't die from that.
What about the ones who fell?

1300.caption: My name is Ashitaka!\NI have come here from far to the east!
Are you ancient gods\Nof the forest of the Deer God?

1400.caption: A kodama? Are they here, too?
Let them be and they won't cause trouble.\NThey're a sign the forest is healthy.
No, even scarier... A huge monster!
Yakul's not afraid.\NThere's no danger here.
We beg passage through your woods.
There's a trail across the river.\NWe'll never get through these woods!
And if we don't get this man\Nback soon, it'll be too late.
Are you showing us the way, or getting us lost?
Sir! These things aren't helping us get home.

1500.caption: Sir! These things aren't helping us get home.
There's more and more of them!
This is your mother? A fine tree!
Footprints from that girl and the wolves...\NIs this where they live?
We're getting in deeper, sir.\NThis way leads into the other world.

1600.caption: Are you all right, sir?\NYou're awfully pale...

1700.caption: Why does he suddenly feel so light?
I'm cured! Ow! No, it's broken.
Sir! You're exactly right!\NWe're back at the ironworks!
We melt iron sand into iron.
- Someone's coming from the forest!\N- A monster?
It's me! Koroku the ox driver!
It's true! He's coming by boat right now!
What's all this noise?!\NBe quiet when I'm writing!

1800.caption: What's all this noise?!\NBe quiet when I'm writing!
Koroku's come back from the dead!
What?!
You're not a ghost.
- Where are the others?\N- Two more of you fell...
It's just us left.
It's never the guards that die...
Move!
Gonza, sir, who's the man in the hood?
I haven't seen the likes of him before...
Listen, riflemen... this gentleman\Ncarried your man all the way here.
Thank him.
Ow! Don't grab me there!
Hey, you! Wait!
First, my thanks for bringing back our men.
But something bothers me...
You got here in less than half the time we did...
...from the valley, carrying a man,\Nthrough the Deer God's forest...
Koroku! You're alive!
Toki!
Look at that leg! You're an ox driver!\NHow are we supposed to eat now?!
But... but...
Scaring me half to death!\NThe wolves should've eaten you!
Then I could find a better husband!
Toki! Forgive me!

1900.caption: Toki, save your love talk for later.
And you! Leaving them there to die!
Some escort you are!\NYou've never done any real work here.
At least act when there's danger!
Thank you. My husband's an idiot,\Nbut I'm glad he's safe.
Good. I was starting to worry that\NI shouldn't have brought him.
You look very handsome.\NShow us your face!
I would like to thank the traveler.\NBring him to me later.
It's good you're back. I apologize.
Don't say that, Milady.\NHe'll just take advantage of you.
Forgive me too, Toki.\NI shouldn't have let it happen.
No, if it'd have only been men there,\Nthey'd all be in a wolf's belly right about now!
Hey, I knew it! You are handsome!

2000.caption: We had to fight off Moro to get\Nthis rice, you know. Be thankful!
Just dish it out already!
Where, where?
Him?
Toki was right!
- He {\i1}is{\i0} handsome!\N- A bit young...
That never stopped you before!
Quiet out there! We're holding a wake!
There's lots of handsome men here too!
No way! Bunch of cowherds!
Come over to our place, traveler!\NForget this stinking barn!
Watch your mouth! We risked our lives\Nto bring you the rice you're eating.
And who makes the iron that buys that rice?
We work those bellows all night long!
I would like to see where you work,\Nif you don't mind.
Really?!
We'll have to work in makeup!
Rouge, too?
Don't forget! We'll be waiting!
Don't mind them, sir.
Lady Eboshi spoils them.
A good town has happy women.
Still, women at an ironworks?
Their presence defiles the iron.
When it comes to Milady,\Nshe takes in every brothel girl she finds!
She's a kind person.
You're spitting out rice, old man.
But she's not afraid of ancient laws or curses.
Or of gods, either.
You should've seen her with Nago!
Nago?
This gigantic boar.\NHe ruled everything around here.
No one could get near the mountains.
All we could do was\Nsit here and look up at their riches.

2100.caption: All we could do was\Nsit here and look up at their riches.
The sand down below was all worked out.
Lots of people had their eye on\Nthis place. The boars got them all.
That's our job, to strip mountains and cut trees.
The lord of the mountain got mad.
Then Lady Eboshi came along with her guns.
No, I was just thinking about that boar...
He must have died full of hate.
Ashitaka, is it? Sorry to keep you waiting.
We were running late with tomorrow's shipment.
Let's take a rest. Tell the others.

2200.caption: Let's take a rest. Tell the others.
Some think you're spying\Nfor the samurai, or the beasts.
Many have their eyes on our ironworks.
May I ask why you've journeyed here?
The stone that shattered the bones of a giant\Nboar god, rotted his flesh, and made him a demon.
When I tried to stop him, I was left\Nwith this scar, a curse unto death.
Where is your land?\NI've never seen an elk like yours.
Between north and east.\NI won't say more than that.
Answer when you're asked or I'll cut you in two!
So, if you knew the secret of that stone,\Nwhat would you do?
See with eyes unclouded, and decide.
I'll show you my secret. Come.

2300.caption: My garden, where none dare come.
Come, if you wish to know my secret.
Even though you hold it so lightly...
Too light and it'll fall apart.
They aren't only for me.\NThe other women here will use them, too.
This is the new gun these people have contrived.
The Chinese ones are too heavy and hard to use.
These guns will kill monsters\Nand pierce samurai armor.
Beware! Lady Eboshi\Nwants to rule the country!
I'm sorry to rush you.\NI'll send sake later.
You stole the god of the mountain's\Nwoods and made a demon of him.
Now will you breed new hatred with those guns?

2400.caption: It is me that brainless pig should have cursed.
Would your right arm like to kill me?
To lift the curse, the whole of me would, too.
But I fear my arm would not stop there.
Must it kill everyone here in order to be at peace?
Milady... do not scorn the young man's strength.
Young man, I too am cursed.
I know well your rage and your grief.
I know this, but I beg you not to kill this lady.
She is the only one who looked upon us as human.
...she washed our rotting flesh, bandaged us...
To live is to suffer. It is to feel pain...
The world is cursed, people\Nare cursed, but still we wish to live...

2500.caption: At night they come to plant trees\Nand take back the mountain.
Ashitaka, will you stay here and work with us?
Do you want even the Deer God's woods?
Without the ancient gods,\Neven monsters become mere beasts.
With the forest alight and the wolves\Ncontained, this will be a land of riches.
Even Princess Mononoke will be human again.
The pitiful girl whose soul the wolves stole.
It is said the blood\Nof the Deer God cures all disease.
It could cure these people,\Nand perhaps even heal your scar.
Very well made.\NPerfect for ruling the country.
But it's still a bit heavy.

2600.caption: Toki, let me work the bellows.
You'll never keep that pace, traveler.
Yep. We work four days straight.
Yeah, but it's better than life in the towns, right?
We eat our fill, and the men know their place.

2700.caption: Thank you, but there is someone I must meet.
I don't want to fight you!
Build up the fires! Riflemen\Nto the stockade! Keep her inside!
Stay at your posts! Don't panic!
- Is she alone?\N- Yes. It appears she's cornered.

2800.caption: - Is she alone?\N- Yes. It appears she's cornered.
Princess Mononoke,\Ncan you hear me? I'm right here.
If you would avenge your tribe...
...here are some who seek vengeance for husbands...
Come out! We'll settle this tonight!
- It's Princess Mononoke!\N- She's coming down!
Out of the way! You'll get hit!
Princess of Wolves, go back\Nto the forest! Don't die for nothing!
There is courage in retreating, too!\NGo back to the forest!
Let him do as he likes.

2900.caption: Even cut off, a wolf's head can still bite.
Gonza, sir, are you all right?

3000.caption: You! You're one of them, too!
Planning to make that wolf your bride?
There is a demon inside you. And in her.
Look on this! It is the form\Nof hate and resentment within me!
It is a curse that rots my flesh\Nand summons my death!
Do not surrender yourself to hatred!
Don't worry. She'll be all right.
Wait! You don't treat Lady Eboshi like that!

3100.caption: Bring me my gun!\NRiflemen, assemble here!
The gate can't be opened without orders.
You saved one of us.\NWe don't want to harm you.
I came here on my own two feet.\NI will leave on them.
It's impossible.\NIt takes ten men to open that gate!

3200.caption: Did they shoot you? Are you dead?
Why did you interfere?\NSpeak while you still live!
I didn't want to let you die.
I'm not afraid to die if it'll drive the humans away!

3300.caption: I'm not afraid to die if it'll drive the humans away!
I've known that since I first saw you.
You're the one that's going\Nto die in vain for getting in my way!
I'll cut your throat! That'll shut you up!
Live...
You're still talking?! I don't obey humans!
You're beautiful...
What's wrong, San?\NShall I crunch him for you?
The apes...
Apes! Do you mean disrespect\Nto the tribe of Moro?
This is our forest.
Give us man.
Give us man and go.
Leave, before my fangs find you.
Go. Go.
We eat man.
We eat him.
Let us eat man.
Why would the tribe of the apes,\Nsages of the forest...
...want to eat a man?
We eat man. We get his strength.
We want strength to drive\Nhumans away. That's why eat.
You won't get that power by eating a man.
All that will do is corrupt\Nyour blood and kill your tribe.
We plant trees. Plant trees. Plant trees.

3400.caption: We plant trees. Plant trees. Plant trees.
Humans all destroy.\NForest not return. We want kill humans.
The Deer God is with us.\NDon't give up, plant your trees.
Moro's tribe will fight with you until the end!
Deer God not fight. We die.
Wolf girl not care. Wolf girl human.
You damned monkey! I'll break your neck!
You go ahead. I'll deal with the human.

3500.caption: You're smart.\NYou know not to set foot on this island.
Go where you want. Live as you please.

3600.caption: Go where you want. Live as you please.

3700.caption: That's why we've been sitting\Nin these stinking bear skins!
Looking at the Deer God will make you go blind!
This from the west land's best hunter?
This is a charter from the Emperor...
...allowing us to kill the Deer God, so come on!
At night he becomes the Night-Walker.
As night becomes day he changes form.

3800.caption: They're lords of some other mountain.
South Island? He crossed the sea?
There's no mistaking those four tusks.
Looks like he brought his whole tribe!

3900.caption: If you're awake, thank Yakul.\NHe watched over you the whole time.
How do you know his name?
He's told me all about himself.\NAnd you, your village, your forests.
The Deer God brought you\Nback to life, so I'll help you.
I had this strange dream... A golden deer...

4000.caption: We're here to kill the humans\Nand protect the forest.

4100.caption: She is my daughter.
The humans are everywhere. Go back\Nto your mountain and kill them there.
We kill for the forest of the Deer God.
Why is there a man here?
The Deer God healed his wound.\NWe must give him back alive.
The Deer God saved a human?\NThe Deer God healed a human?!
Why did he not save Nago?
Is he not the guardian of the forest?!
The Deer God gives life, and takes it away.
Have you forgotten even that, you boars?
No! You begged the Deer God for him.
You did not beg for Nago!
He feared death. As now do I...
I too carry within me a poisoned human stone.
Nago fled. I remain, and contemplate my death.
Moro, go to the Deer God!
I have lived long enough, San.
The Deer God will not\Nheal my would, but take my life.
No, Mother! You've protected the Deer God!
We are not fooled! Nago was beautiful\Nand strong. Our brother would not run!
You wolves ate him!
Silence! You slander my mother!
Hear me, O wild mountain gods...
It was I who killed Nago.
He had become a demon, and attacked\Nour village. I killed him reluctantly.
A huge boar god. Here is my proof.

4200.caption: I came to this land on the chance\Nthat the Deer God might lift this curse.
He healed my wound, but the scar remains.
I must suffer until its curse destroys me.
Okkoto's here. Finally,\Nsomeone who knows something.
You are Moro's daughter.\NI have heard rumors of you.
Stand back. I will not eat him.
Do not fear. I tell of Nago's end.
My thanks to you, young one.
It grieves us that a demon has come from our tribe.
Lord Okkoto... is there no way to lift this curse?
Leave this forest. Next time we meet,\NI will have to kill you as well.
Okkoto, you cannot win against\Nthe guns of the humans by numbers alone.
Look on my tribe, Moro.\NWe grow small, and we grow stupid.

4300.caption: Look on my tribe, Moro.\NWe grow small, and we grow stupid.
To go on in this manner...
...is to end as mere meat that the humans hunt for.
To risk all on a single battle\Nis to play into human hands.
I ask not for the help of wolves.
Should we die even to the very last,\Nwe will leave the humans in awe.
Hold your fire... Draw them in!
That damned Eboshi's fighting the wrong enemy!

4400.caption: That damned Eboshi's fighting the wrong enemy!
You all go on ahead and hide.
I see them! They're back!
Boss...
Well done.
We're moving out. Tell the others.
Hello, Monk Jiko.
The Lords' Alliance presses,\Nand you sport with country samurai...
Lord Asano sets them against me.
Asano? A powerful man...
He wants half of my iron.
Greedy, isn't he.
But now is no time to fight men.
The boar gods are gathering in the forest.
Give him the iron this time.
Once you keep your promise to the Lords' Alliance,\Nyou can fight whoever you want.
Quick, Milady!\NThe samurai are coming!
Speak of the devil! Asano's messenger.
A messenger. Remember your manners.
Welcome back!
Aren't you going to see him?

4500.caption: Aren't you going to see him?
Eboshi, Mistress of the Ironworks,\Nyou have fought well!
I bring a message from the shogun.\NOpen your gates!
We hear you fine from there!
Milady took this mountain from the beasts!
Now it's worth something and you want it!
We haven't had respect since we were born!
Samurai or monsters, they don't care.
You think this paper's of any value?
Well, it's helped in getting\Nthe best hunters and trackers.
We're killing a god, not just beasts.
As we make iron here,\Nthe power of the forest grows weaker.
We've spent enough time and money.
We didn't send 40 riflemen just to make iron.

4600.caption: We didn't send 40 riflemen just to make iron.
So says the Lords' Alliance, at least.
Surely they don't believe that\Nthe Deer God's head confers immortality?
I'm not privy to the thoughts\Nof the Lords' Alliance.
Best not to be.
You have my word.
That pack of boars will be easier\Nthan Moro and her tribe.
Call out that shady bunch\Nyou've got hidden under the cliff.
So I'm found out, am I?
One more thing...
Did a young man pass by here?
A curious young man riding a red elk?
He left.
They make my skin crawl!
They're not ordinary hunters.\NThey're special scouts.
Special scouts?
Let us go with you!
Don't trust those men!
We can't help you from here if anything happens!
We've learned how to shoot...
That's the reason I want you here,\Nto protect this place.
I fear humans more than monsters.
With the Deer God dead, much will become clear.
Is the Deer God's head\Nall the Lords' Alliance really wants?
It won't be just the samurai.\NWe may have to fight the riflemen, too.
We can't depend on the men. Stay on your toes.

4700.caption: We can't depend on the men. Stay on your toes.
Don't worry about Lady Eboshi.\NI'll protect her.
Maybe if you were a woman...
You could end it all by jumping, you know.
When your strength returns,\Nthe scar will grow restless.
I feel like I've slept for days.
I dreamed she was tending to me.

4800.caption: I hoped you would cry out in your sleep,\Nso I could bite off your head.
A beautiful forest...
Is Okkoto moving yet?
Go back into the cave, boy.\NYou can't hear it...
The cry of the forest trampled by boars...
I sit here listening to it\Nand to the crumbling of my body...
...and wait for that woman...
...dreaming of the moment\NI crush her head in my jaws.
Moro, can't humans and the forest\Nlive together in peace?
Can this truly not be stopped?
The humans are gathering.
Their fire will reach even here.
And San? Do you intend to take her with you?
How like a human... Such a selfish thought...
San is a daughter of our tribe.\NWhen the forest dies, we too shall perish.
Set her free! She's human!
Silence, boy!
Can {\i1}you{\i0} ease her sorrow?
San, the infant that the humans who violated\Nthe forest threw to me in order to escape my fangs...
Now she cannot be human,\Nand she cannot be wolf.
My poor, ugly, lovely daughter...
Can you save her?!
I don't know, but together we can live.
How?! Will you join with San\Nand fight the human race?
No! All that does is cause more hatred.
There is nothing you can do, boy.

4900.caption: There is nothing you can do, boy.
Soon the scar will kill you.
Leave here when the sun rises.
Thanks to you and the Deer God.

5000.caption: It's too quiet... Even the kodama are gone...
Thank you for guiding me.\NI have a favor to ask.
What a stench! It's hard to breathe.

5100.caption: What a stench! It's hard to breathe.
That's not just smoke.\NIt's to blunt our sense of smell.
They're trying to lure the boars out of the forest.
We've got to warn them!\NThe boars are starting to move!
They know it's a trap, but still they'll charge.
The last one alive\Nwill still be charging forward.
The smoke will blind Lord Okkoto.
Although there is a life for you\Nwith that young man...
I will stay with the Deer God.

5200.caption: The tribe of Moro fights with you!\NWhere is Lord Okkoto?

5300.caption: It's not a ghost, is it.
They thought they'd catch us\Nwhile the men were away!

5400.caption: They thought they'd catch us\Nwhile the men were away!
We showed 'em!
- They thought we'd be easy!\N- Where's Lady Eboshi?
She took every man who could move\Nand went to eliminate the Deer God.
We're cut off and can't reach her!
The Deer God? So that sound before...
Sir! I've still got your bow!
What about his saddle and cloak?!
But...
Useless!
Koroku, thanks!
I'll bring help from Eboshi. Can you hold out?
We'll pour molten iron on them if we have to!
We're counting on you, Ashitaka!
Bring Lady Eboshi, quick!
Missed!
They're bringing boats. Hurry!
Bring Lady Eboshi! We'll fight, too!
I'll be back! Good luck!
- We'll be here!\N-Be safe!
There he is! Get him!
They're after us. Come on, Yakul!

5500.caption: Wait here. I'll be right back.
Hang in there, we're almost there...

5600.caption: Hang in there, we're almost there...
This is a realm of demigods.\NOutsiders must leave at once!
I was indebted to these men.\NI have an urgent message for Lady Eboshi.
Eboshi's not here. State your business.
I will speak to her directly! Where is she?!
There's still time. The women\Nare holding the inner stockade.
She's gone to the forest kill the Deer God...
Call her back! There's no time!
If you're done, get out of here!
They want to abandon the ironworks!

5700.caption: They want to abandon the ironworks!
If we wait we'll be too late!
The forest is huge. He'd never find her!
A flare then, anything!\NIsn't that your specialty?
Were there any wolves with the boars?
I don't know...\NIt was pitch black when they came at us.
I don't know. Suddenly\NI didn't know what was going on.
The scouts put us out there\Nas bait to lure the boars in.

5800.caption: Calm down! I want to help you.
A wolf! There's a wolf still alive over here!
Move! What are you doing, boy?!
I'm asking him to guide me.\NI'm going to get Eboshi.
So you're with them, are you?
What's more important, the head\Nof the Deer God or the ironworks?!
Go through the swamp and hide near the lake.
Be careful. The riflemen are with them.
Hold onto this for me. My last arrow's broken.
Find San! That's where Eboshi is!

5900.caption: Don't fall behind the scouts.\NToday we finish this!
Okkoto's hurt. He and Princess Mononoke\Nare headed deeper into the forest.
Just as expected. They're going to ask\Nthe Deer God for help. Stay with them.
But stay hidden, or he won't appear.
Is that boar's blood on his face?
A scout technique. Repulsive, isn't it...
Keep going!\NWe're almost at the Deer God's pond.
Something's wrong, Lord Okkoto!\NJust a bit further!
What is it?\NI can't smell anything with all this blood.
It is your fault. Forest will die.
Is this how you thank those\Nwho fought for your forest?

6000.caption: You brought things neither animal nor human!
My warriors have returned\Nfrom the land of the dead!
Forward, my warriors! To the Deer God!
Lord Okkoto, calm yourself!\NDeceased beings can't come back to life!
They're wearing boar skins to hide their scent!
Stop! They want us\Nto take them to the Deer God!
If you are god of this forest,\Nrevive my clan to slay the humans!

6100.caption: We're surrounded!\NHe's done for. Leave him!
No! Then he'll become a demon!
Tell Mother it's the Deer God the humans want!
Go! We can't let our kind die out!
I'll kill the first one that moves.\NI'll tell the whole forest what you are!
I burn! A flame bursts from within me!
No, Lord Okkoto! Don't turn into a demon!
- What is it?\N- San's in danger!

6200.caption: I don't want to be a demon! Lord Okkoto!
The samurai are attacking the ironworks!\NLeave the Deer God and return!
The men are heading down the mountain!\NThey're waiting for you!

6300.caption: None! I would have stayed and fought if I could!
So it's "don't kill the Deer God,\Nkill the samurai," is it?
No! Can't the forest\Nand the ironworks live together?
I've done all I can for the women.\NThey can protect themselves.
It's now or never. Stay alert.
Killing a god's a scary task.\NLet her do it for us.

6400.caption: If we fight, the Deer God won't appear.
Okkoto! Return the\NPrincess of Wolves! Where is San?
San, can you hear me? It's me, Ashitaka!
And here I was saving my last bit\Nof strength for that woman...

6500.caption: And here I was saving my last bit\Nof strength for that woman...
Stay away from him, you two.
His curse is not yours to bear.
Can you not even speak now?
Well done. Fall back and tend to the wounded.

6600.caption: Eboshi! Your enemy here\Nis not the Deer God!
Is the Deer God taking life?!

6700.caption: Oh no! He's starting to change!
This is how you kill a god.
The Deer God is also the god of death.

6800.caption: Don't touch the body!\NIt'll draw your life into it!
Moro's head... It moved by itself!

6900.caption: Give her to me! I'll tear her apart!
Moro's taken revenge.\NShe's already gotten her punishment.
I promised Toki and the others\NI'd bring you back.
He's looking for his head. It's not safe here.
No! You're on the humans' side!
Take that woman and go away!
I am human... and so are you.
I'm sorry. I tried to stop it.
It's over. Everything.\NThe forest is dead.
No, it's not. We're still alive. Help me.

7000.caption: A little crisis and they're useless...
I wonder if that young man found Milady...
I'm sure he did.\NThey're probably almost here now.
Look at that face! Hey, Koroku!

7100.caption: Look at that face! Hey, Koroku!
Let him sleep while he can.
I don't like the sound of that...
What should we do? He's coming this way!
We guard the ironworks!\NWe promised Milady we would.
The Deer God's coming after his head!
Touch that muck and you're dead!
Run into the lake!\NThe water'll slow it down!
The men and Eboshi\Nare coming from the other side!
We're going to give\Nthe Deer God his head back!

7200.caption: Once the forge starts to burn, it's all over.
As long as we're alive, we'll manage.\NMove out deeper. Hurry!
I'll give the head back.\NPut it down and run.
Don't be stupid. Give it back now?\NThe sun's coming up.
Look... a brainless, swollen,\Nlife-sucking god of death.
When the sun comes up, he'll vanish.
Wanting all between heaven\Nand earth is the human condition.

7300.caption: Wanting all between heaven\Nand earth is the human condition.
I don't want to kill you...
Don't you understand? It's too late!
Ashitaka, don't waste\Nyour time talking to humans!

7500.caption: Amazing... I didn't know the Deer God\Nmade the flowers bloom...

7600.caption: Even if they grow back,\Nthey won't be the Deer God's woods.
The Deer God can't die. He is life itself.
Life and death are both his, to give and to take.
He's telling us we should live.
I like you, Ashitaka, but I can't forgive\Nwhat people have done.
That's all right. You live in\Nthe forest, and I'll live at the ironworks.
How pathetic...\NSaved thanks to a wolf!
Someone bring Ashitaka.\NI want to thank him.
We'll start over again.\NWe'll build a good village.
I give up... You can't win against fools!

7700.caption: {\an1\fs55.371\fscx90\fad(100,100)\shad1.205\be0\bord3.612}Lady Eboshi: TANAKA Yuko\NMonk Jiko: KOBAYASHI Kaoru
{\be26\fad(500,500)}The trembling string of the drawn bow
{\be0\fad(500,500)}tsuki no hikari ni zawameku omae no kokoro
{\be26\fad(500,500)}Your heart that stirs in the light of the moon
{\be0\fad(500,500)}sono kissaki ni yoku nita sonata no yokogao
{\be26\fad(500,500)}and your profile that resembles its tip
{\be0\fad(500,500)}kanashimi to ikari ni hisomu makoto no kokoro wo
{\be26\fad(500,500)}Concealed beneath sorrow and rage, thy true heart is
{\be26\fad(500,500)}Understood only by the souls of the forest

7800.caption: {\an1\fs55.371\fscx90\fad(100,100)\shad1.205\be0\bord3.612}Theme song "Mononoke-hime"\NLyrics by MIYAZAKI Hayao\NMusic by HISAISHI Joe\NPerformed by MERA Yoshikazu
